reviews.review: m

For casual gamers:

This game is quite fum and can give You a lot of joy.

For gamers who seek some competition:

This game is absolute garbage in this way.
1. Killers have way more advantages than survivors which leads to game being unbalanced.
2. Game has a lot of bugs that can cause unfair advantages for opponent team.
3. Ranking system in this game is illogical. One game You will play with ranks that are way lower than Yours, the other game You will play with ranks that are way higher than Yours. As well ranking up is so easy, just farm and that's it- No skill no pain- just gain.
4. The community is way more toxic than in other games. If You consider games like LOL and CS as toxic community games, You are wrong. This is on the next level- there is almost no games without flame players at the end. As well people playing without any respect for others.
5. If You consider Yourself tryharding in this game, don't play survivor- play only killer. It will be a lot easier for You to learn and be good at it.

PS. If you are a Killer main, don't even talk, because You don't know how hard is to be a survivor.

Game is so ridiculously imbalanced it's a joke. Everyone who plays it knows it, but since there's no other game to take it's place it still stays somewhat relevant. If only Evolve didn't flop.

Edit: Game is in the worst state it's ever been in since the implementation of MMR. More bugs, more crashes, more hackers. Do not purchase the game if you haven't already. Also, the DbD forum mods are extremely bad, be sure not to post anything there or you will be permanently banned for some reason that has nothing to do with the ban.

Just on 15 mins ago, a "rank 1" killer had been face-camped to me when only 2 generators repaired. It is so disappoint to the killer & game creator.  SO SUCK!

Recomiendo el juego?
Si y a la vez no, por que?

bueno DBD es un juego que es divertido pero puede llegar a ser estresante, en este juego luego de 4 años su hitbox sigue siendo una mierda, creo que hay personajes como Michael Myers o otros asesinos de pago que son demasiados chetados y si te llega a tocar un killer con alguno de esos personajes que juega al menos bien dile adios a tu vida. Yo creo que en este juego los desarrolladores se preocupan mas por los asesinos que por los survivors, siento que hay un desequilibrio en los dos bandos y el ganador es el killer (los mapas estan hechos para que te maten y te maten una y otra vez, habilidades o perks de asesinos asquerosas, add ons para armas chetadisimos etc)

Pero dejando de lugar todo lo malo del juego, este juego me parece interesante, las mecanicas me parecen divertidas, y jugar con amigos lo hace todavia mas divertido. Jugar partidas privadas con amigos es muy divertido, en publicas tambien lo es pero ten en cuenta de que te vas a encontrar a todo tipo de gente ya sea camper, tunelera , o que use asesino con memento mori de ebano, add ons y perks asquerosas pero al fin de al cabo este juego es uno de mis favoritos, se preguntaran "como que favorito si solo tenes 20 horas" bueno yo jugaba este juego en ps4 y la pc me la arme hace relativamente poco (bueno no les voy a contar mi vida)

CONCLUSION: 

Les recomiendo este juego? 

Si, pero compratelo advertido y preparado, compratelo si tienes paciencia y te vas a tomar tu tiempo en mejorar y aprender 

Saludos nos vemos en la hoguera
Pay to win. Disgrace to society and really unpleasant. Surivors have less advantages than killer

I have played this game for years on ps4 and finally have moved on to pc, and couldn't be happier about it. Absolutely wonderful game, although it could use some balancing in certain aspects that's for sure. For example; the hooks in my opinion are far too many in such close proximity. Being a killer main myself, i find this to be just a little too easy and would like further challenge through some well spaced hooks. Another being the balancing of certain killers, as their lunges are either far too long or not nearly enough. A prime example would be Freddy. I understand that in the movies he could stretch his arms to profound distances, but seeing as this is not in the game as a perk itself I believe his lunge could be shortened. Despite some of these balancing issues the game all in all, is absolutely astounding and I would recommend this to any avid fan of this genre of game.
fun

100 hours later & counting.
A community that expects you to be good the second you play the game. Unbalanced and irritating most times. Getting face-camped if you're a survivor. Getting tea-bagged at the gate if you're a killer. In the end it has you questioning if anyone really wins. 
* You'll get teammates that will hide in a corner or a locker waiting for you to finish all the gens because they're too scared to actually play the game. 
* Those same teammates wont rescue you if needed. They'll instead look for the hatch.
* You'll come across ones that put themselves on a pedestal for knowing how to loop a killer while doing absolutely nothing else, then call the rest of the team trash.
* Bubba.
All around a pretty toxic community, but in all honesty that's something you can toss to the side :) cause what game isn't at times. Most definitely the worst and best game to buy. I play it almost every day, 10/10 recommend it.

I've played this game for over 100 hours and have decided to update it based on my experience. I stand by my original statement that this game is best played in a custom lobby with 5 friends. The game itself is an interesting concept but the developers really don't know much about what they're doing. They haphazardly put things together and throw it at the player as new content.

On a surface level that sounds great. New content coming out regularly. However, these ideas mostly perks end up Meta or nerfed into a joke. Trickster just came out a month ago and it was just a mess and in a few weeks we get the Resident Evil DLC. So they release an underwhelming killer and now just abandoned it to work on something else.... Ok!

Matchmaking is a joke as well. Apparently they're working on it. However at the recent rank reset (which in my opinion is a little too frequent) Experienced players got brought to the lowest rank. Other resets it put you in the highest rank level before reset. (Example: Finished in red, start the next "season" in 5 purple). Making the game disheartening to new players or casual players who don't fully understand the concept of the game.

Which brings me to the next problem. Learning how to play the game! The tutorial literally teaches you the bare minimum. Nothing on looping, scratch marks, did you know each survivor has different stats? I didn't until I saw a Youtube video about it. There's nothing in the manual about it. You're basically going to learn this game through trial and error. Hopefully you'll play against someone near your skill level so you won't just enjoy the game from spectate mode.

On the killer side they fixed decisive strike so it's not such a pain in the ass. As a killer to play somewhat competitively you're basically going to be running slow down perks a lot as the survivors only have one objective; which is to do generators. There is a side objective to do totems which as a killer these totems can be used by a perk called a hex. What's unfortunate about Hex's is that they're placed randomly sometimes they're placed so badly that you lose one of your perks in the first minute of the game. A nice solution would be to allow the killer to choose which totem becomes a hex by clicking on it or something. 

A bummer on the killers side is keys. If you're starting to win at mid game the survivors have an opportunity to win the game if less then 3 gens remain and they have a key to escape though hatch. In a way you can consider this a victory as a killer because you made them take the "cowards" way out but it's just disappointing tasting victory and seeing the survivors walk away with a get out of jail free card. However, regarding hatch, It's also ridiculous as a survivor who's at a disadvantage in a 1v1 to have a hatch shut on them and the only means of escape is a 50/50 shot at waiting by an exit gate and hoping the killer goes to the wrong one. You could technically find a key but it's not guaranteed.

On the survivors side, all you're predominately doing is generators and the odd hex/totem. That's it! that's you're objective. Running the killer to waste their time and saving teammates who fail to run the killer. Each character has their own set of perks and stats and their stats are basically how hard they breath when running or hurt. It's not explained to you anywhere so I'm telling you here.

Last thing that people wonder is if this game is P2W the answer is No. It's pay for convenience. There's an area in the store section called Shrine of Secrets. Every Tuesday 2 killer perks and 2 survivor perks are posted which can be bought with a currency earned though game. Pretty much every perk has appeared once already. However, the one perk everyone wants called BBQ & Chilli rarely shows up but some something like borrowed time will show up 5 times in 7 weeks. They're aware of this as it's the main selling point for the Texas Chainsaw DLC.

Game play wise: The rules are very loose. Personally I'm cool with most mechanics aside from what's known as Tunnelling. Which is when a killer just targets you to get you out of the game as fast as possible. There is a time and place for it. It's a great way to apply pressure. However it just understandably aggravates people. This game is suppose to be like a horror movie. Where you confront a villain, they mess you up and you get away to regroup and they come after you again. There's a perk called, "Play with your food" for Michael Myers. Which I would say is how the game should be played so that everyone can get the most enjoyment out of their time.

So, essentially I just bad mouthed this game for a few paragraphs and still recommend it. Why? I've had the most fun playing this game in a private lobby with 4 other friends. In that regard the game is fun. Since the developers have a very hands-off approach to the rules of the game. Playing with friends in a private lobby where everyone wants to have fun creates a lot of good times. When there's guidelines that are respected this game can be amazing.

If you're going to play by yourself. I recommend playing as a killer. In general, just show etiquette and don't Camp or Tunnel survivors. As survivors make an effort to unhook your teammates at endgame, don't wait for the killer to find you at the exit or hatch and sit there t-bagging. Just leave! If you're going to hide in the far corner of a map or in a locker waiting for your team to die to escape hatch find a different game to play.
Great game to play with friends. If your down for a little thrill but loads of fun this is the right game.
